reviews.text: I took a small group of 14 to Paestum for a family reunion. I did my homework on Tripadvisor to pick this hotel. It was a great find. It opened in the '60 but was completely renovated last year by Signora Giusy & her husband Giovanni. I chose the 1/2 pensione plan which included breakfast and dinner. The breakfast was O.K. Eggs were offered if you wished them. However, the dinners were of gourmet quality. The service was professional and friendly. Over all my clients were impressed with my choice of hotels.

reviews.title: One of my worst hotel experiences
reviews.text: I was happy to book this hotel after reading all the good reviews on this site, However, for me it turned out to be one of the worst hotel experience. First, the good points. Hotel is really beautiful, you can hardly find any faults to its looks. Beautiful garden, pool, free parking lot, nice rooms, large bathroom with modern facilities... Hotel is close to the beach and use of beach facilities is included in the room rate.

reviews.title: A perfect gem...
reviews.text: Now, the bad points. Hotel is in the middle of nowhere, nothing in radius of 3 km, no shops, no bars, no restaurants. If you do not have a car, you are lost. Hotel staff is completely helpless and uninterested. Only a couple of them speaks English, difficult to communicate with them. The worst of all is bar/restaurant staff. They completely ignore you! One night I sat for 30 minutes at the bar terrace, waiting to be served and I was not. I complained to the receptionist and received "I am sorry". The other night I was persistant to see when they will pay attention to guests and I was served after 53 minutes. You should have in mind that this is a small hotel and there were not more than 20 guests at total, so there is no big crowd to be served.

reviews.title: A nice hotel
reviews.text: The breakfast is a complete disaster. I travelled extensively through Italy this summer and this was absolutely the worst breakfast I had. I cannot comment on food for dinner since I did not have it - too expensive, I believe. They offer a menu for 40 EUR per person, so dinner for two plus drinks is 100+ EUR.

reviews.title: Quality Hotel
reviews.text: I booked a tour through the hotel. I specifficaly asked if there was an English speaking tour and they confirmed. I ended up with a group of Italians, who had extensive explanation from a tour guide, while I received a few words in bad English - this is a cathedral, you can go up the street, be here in 90 minutes. And I paid the same price as Italians. The tour started at 6.20 AM so I asked for an early breakfast from the reception and they said there were no problems just to tell them in the morning what I wanted. And in the morning there were no one in the hotel, only one Italian guy (safe-keeper, I guess), who knew not a single word of English, so I had to say goodbuy to my early breakfast.

reviews.title: Fabulous stay in Paestum!
reviews.text: The hotel offers a free cable internet in the rooms (no wi-fi), but this is rather inconvenient. You need a code to access the internet, each code last for one hour, the connection automatically stops after each 25 minutes so you have to reconnect. Each time you spend one hour of internet, you must go the reception and ask for a new code. The connection is rather slow and sometimes completely useless.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent modern room, completely refurbished in 2006. We spent three nights whist we explored Paestum, Velia and the Cilento coast. Great garden and pool. Remote from any town centre, car needed.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel, recently refurbished, well priced.
Closed for Renovations - May 2, 2006
reviews.text: The hotel is located next door to the palatial Savoy Hotel which has a well priced restaurant, Il Tre Olivo, very good food and service.

We booked a 1 night stay at the Best Western Esplanade in April. When we arrived in Paestum in early May we were shocked to find that the hotel was completely closed for renovations. Our initial shock turned to delight when they advised that we would be accommodated at the 4-star Hotel Savoy next door at no extra charge. The Savoy was by far the nicest....and lowest priced hotel of our entire 2 week European vacation. Sometimes the stars just align.....
